body_html:
@llevar, what worked for me is copying the global.css file from this git repository to the location listed in the error log in your earlier comment. That is, I copied global.css to where tensorboard was looking for it on my system: /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/tensorboard/lib/css/.

From your earlier comment, it looks like you might want to copy that global.css file to the following location on your system: /usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/tensorboard/lib/css/. Also, you will probably need to create that css directory first.
body_text:
@llevar, what worked for me is copying the global.css file from this git repository to the location listed in the error log in your earlier comment.  That is, I copied global.css to where tensorboard was looking for it on my system: /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/tensorboard/lib/css/.
From your earlier comment, it looks like you might want to copy that global.css file to the following location on your system: /usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/tensorboard/lib/css/.  Also, you will probably need to create that css directory first.
body:
@llevar, what worked for me is copying the global.css file from this git repository to the location listed in the error log in your earlier comment.  That is, I copied [global.css](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tensorboard/lib/css/global.css) to where tensorboard was looking for it on my system: `/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/tensorboard/lib/css/`.

From your earlier comment, it looks like you might want to copy that global.css file to the following location on your system: `/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/tensorboard/lib/css/`.  Also, you will probably need to create that `css` directory first.
